benchmark_details.name: SciCat: A Curated Dataset of Scientific Software Repositories
benchmark_details.overview: The SciCat dataset is a comprehensive collection of Free-Libre Open Source Software (FLOSS) projects, designed to address the need for a curated repository of scientific and research software.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable studies that focus on trends, common practices, challenges, and evolution in scientific software development.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The accuracy and completeness of the dataset depend on the information extracted from README.md files.

data.source: World of Code dataset, consisting of FLOSS repositories.
data.format: Pickle file in a tar.gz archive
data.annotation: Classified by OpenAI’s language models based on README.md files.

methods: Automated classification using OpenAI's language models
methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on Cohen’s Kappa and F1 score metrics from evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better identification of scientific application software.
methodology.validation: Validation conducted using human raters and comparison with existing datasets.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of the gender distribution of project authors included.
